beforeAfter.title: Remarkable Eye Transformations

beforeAfter.disclaimer: Individual results vary. Photos shown with patient consent. Results from combination treatments.

faq.question: How does non-surgical compare to surgical blepharoplasty?
faq.answer: Non-surgical is best for mild to moderate concerns, offering subtler results with minimal downtime and lower cost. Surgery is more suitable for severe hooding or excess skin. Non-surgical results last 6-12 months vs. surgery's 10+ years. However, many prefer non-surgical's natural appearance, safety profile, and ability to adjust gradually.

Not necessarily. Many patients maintain results with periodic maintenance treatments indefinitely. However, if significant excess skin develops, surgery may eventually be more appropriate. Non-surgical treatments can also postpone surgery for years while maintaining a refreshed appearance.
faq.question: Will I still need surgery eventually?
Is treatment around the eyes safe?
faq.answer: Yes, when performed by experienced practitioners. The eye area requires specialized knowledge of anatomy and advanced injection techniques. We use blunt-tip cannulas when appropriate, inject conservatively, and have extensive training in periorbital treatments. Serious complications are extremely rare.

Most patients find it tolerable with numbing cream. The eye area is sensitive, so you may feel pressure or slight pinching. Plasma pen treatment can be more uncomfortable but is manageable. Most describe it as brief discomfort worth enduring for the results.
faq.question: Does it hurt?

faq.answer: Minimal. Expect mild swelling and possible bruising for 3-7 days. Under-eye filler often causes more swelling initially. Plasma pen may cause tiny scabs for 5-7 days. Most patients return to work next day with concealer. Avoid makeup for 24 hours.
faq.question: What's the downtime?
Which technique is best for me?
faq.answer: This depends on your specific concerns. Hooding typically needs brow lift (anti-wrinkle); hollows need filler; excess skin may need plasma pen. Most patients benefit from a combination approach. We'll assess and recommend during consultation.

Varies by technique: anti-wrinkle (3-4 months), tear trough filler (9-12 months), plasma pen (permanent skin tightening with gradual aging). Most patients return every 6-12 months for maintenance to sustain results.
faq.question: How long do results last?
Can I wear makeup afterwards?
faq.answer: Avoid makeup for 24 hours post-treatment. After that, use concealer to camouflage any bruising or swelling. Avoid waterproof or difficult-to-remove makeup that requires harsh rubbing. Be gentle when applying and removing products.

faq.question: What if I don't like the results?
faq.answer: Filler-based treatments are reversible with hyaluronidase. Anti-wrinkle effects fade naturally over 3-4 months. Plasma pen results develop gradually, allowing assessment. We offer complimentary review appointments to assess and adjust if needed.

Age isn't the primary factor—your specific concerns are. Patients typically range from late 30s to 70s+. Younger patients often have brow lift or tear trough filler; older patients may need combination approaches. Suitability determined during consultation.
faq.question: Am I too young/old for this treatment?

faq.answer: Strategic filler placement can minimize the appearance of bags by smoothing the transition, but true puffy bags (fat pads) may be better addressed surgically. We'll assess whether you're a good candidate during consultation.
faq.question: Can this help with naturally puffy eyes?

faq.answer: Pricing varies based on techniques used. Single treatments start from £350. Combination approaches range from £600-1,200. Still significantly less than surgical blepharoplasty (£3,000-6,000). Exact quote provided during consultation.
faq.question: How much does it cost?

hero.subheadline: Transform tired, aging eyes with advanced non-surgical techniques
hero.headline: Brighter Eyes, No Surgery Required

longDescription: Non-surgical blepharoplasty offers a revolutionary way to address drooping eyelids, under-eye bags, and tired-looking eyes without scalpels or significant downtime. Using a strategic combination of anti-wrinkle injections, dermal fillers, and innovative plasma technology, we can lift, tighten, and rejuvenate the eye area—delivering results that rival surgical blepharoplasty.

techniques.subtitle: Multiple advanced techniques for comprehensive eye rejuvenation
techniques.title: Our Non-Surgical Approach

methods.name: Brow Lift with Anti-Wrinkle Injections
methods.description: Strategic injections relax muscles that pull the brow down, allowing natural lift of the brow and reduction of upper eyelid hooding
Hyaluronic acid filler placed in the tear trough to fill hollows, reduce bags' appearance, and brighten dark circles
methods.name: Tear Trough Filler
Lower Eyelid Filler
methods.description: Specialized filler technique to smooth transition between lid and cheek, reducing bag prominence

methods.name: Plasma Pen Skin Tightening
methods.description: Plasma energy creates micro-injuries that trigger skin contraction and collagen production, tightening loose eyelid skin
Platelet-rich plasma improves skin quality, thickness, and darkness around the delicate eye area
methods.name: PRP for Eye Rejuvenation

steps.title: Specialized Eye Assessment
steps.description: Comprehensive evaluation of eye anatomy, including lid position, skin quality, fat distribution, and brow position. We'll determine which combination of treatments will achieve optimal results.
Based on assessment, we create your personalized treatment plan, which may include one or more techniques. We'll explain the approach and expected outcomes.
steps.title: Customized Treatment Planning
Preparation
steps.description: Thorough cleansing of the eye area and application of topical numbing cream for your comfort during treatment.
Expert administration of chosen treatment(s)—anti-wrinkle injections, strategic filler placement, and/or plasma pen treatment. We work meticulously for precision.
steps.title: Treatment Application

steps.description: Ice application to minimize swelling, detailed aftercare instructions, and discussion of what to expect during healing and result development.
steps.title: Immediate Aftercare
Results & Review
steps.description: Initial results visible immediately (filler) to 2 weeks (anti-wrinkle). Swelling subsides over 3-7 days. Complimentary 2-week review to assess and refine.

process.title: Your Eye Rejuvenation Journey
process.subtitle: From consultation to brighter, youthful eyes

schema.howPerformed: We use a customized combination of techniques: (1) Anti-wrinkle injections strategically placed to lift drooping brows and open hooded eyes—the medicine relaxes muscles pulling downward; (2) Hyaluronic acid filler carefully injected beneath hollows and bags using cannulas to smooth transitions and brighten shadows; (3) Optional plasma pen that creates controlled micro-injuries to tighten loose skin through collagen contraction. Each technique is selected based on your specific anatomy. Treatment takes 30-60 minutes total
schema.preparation: Arrive with no eye makeup or contact lenses. Stop blood-thinning supplements for one week. Avoid alcohol 48 hours before. If treating under-eyes, sleep well the night before (ironically!). Bring sunglasses for the journey home. Come with realistic expectations—we're enhancing, not performing surgery. Have photos from 10 years ago showing your eyes at their best
schema.followup: Apply ice packs for 20 minutes every few hours for the first day. Sleep elevated for two nights. Avoid rubbing eyes, wearing contact lenses, or applying eye makeup for 24 hours. No intense workouts or face-down positions for 48 hours. Under-eye swelling typically peaks at 24 hours then improves rapidly. Attend your 2-week review for assessment. Anti-wrinkle effects appear over 7-14 days; filler results are immediate
schema.outcome: Eyes look brighter, more open, and less tired. Hooding reduces, revealing more lid space. Under-eye bags and shadows soften dramatically. Brows lift naturally, making your whole face look more awake and youthful. Friends say you look well-rested and refreshed. Confidence soars—you see yourself in photos and smile. Results last 6-12 months depending on technique used
schema.medicationRequired: Topical numbing cream for all treatments. Optional oral sedative for anxious patients
schema.treatmentFrequency: Single treatment session, then maintenance every 6-12 months. Anti-wrinkle component needs repeat every 3-4 months; filler lasts 9-12 months. Many patients schedule combined maintenance visits twice yearly
schema.adverseOutcome: Mild swelling and possible bruising for 3-7 days. Small bumps at injection sites that smooth within hours. Temporary asymmetry as swelling settles. Very rarely with filler: visible lumps (can be dissolved) or prolonged swelling

seriousAdverseOutcome.name: Vascular occlusion or eyelid ptosis (drooping)
seriousAdverseOutcome.probability: Extremely rare (less than 0.1%) when performed by experienced practitioners using proper periorbital techniques

contraindication: Severe excess skin requiring surgical removal
Certain eye conditions (glaucoma, recent eye surgery)
typicalTest: Detailed periorbital assessment (lid position, skin quality, fat distribution)
Discussion of eye makeup habits and lifestyle
Computer imaging to preview potential improvements
clinicalFindings: Mild to moderate upper eyelid hooding
Drooping brows contributing to hooded appearance
Fine lines and crepey eyelid skin
Desire for refreshed, youthful eye appearance without surgery

overview.title: What is Non-Surgical Blepharoplasty?
highlights: No surgery, scalpels, or general anesthesia
Minimal downtime—back to work next day
overview.content:
Non-surgical blepharoplasty is an umbrella term for advanced, minimally invasive treatments that address common eye area concerns without the need for surgery, general anesthesia, or extensive downtime.

Using a customized combination of treatments—including anti-wrinkle injections for brow lift, strategic filler placement to support the eye area, and plasma pen technology for skin tightening—we can lift drooping eyelids, reduce bags, brighten dark circles, and restore a youthful, refreshed appearance to tired eyes.

safety.content: The eye area requires exceptional skill and anatomical knowledge. We use advanced techniques, premium products, and conservative approaches to ensure both safety and beautiful results.
